items.summary: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

items.title: Queensland's free influenza vaccine program to return this year with nasal spray for children aged two to five
items.summary: The program — which will run from March to September — will provide free flu vaccinations, including a nasal spray option for children aged two to five years.

items.title: Handful of residents remain in Daly River amid impending major flooding, as hundreds evacuated to Darwin
items.summary: Some long-term residents have decided to stay behind in Daly River to help amid impending major flooding, after more than 200 people were evacuated to Darwin.

items.title: Premier Chris Minns says Newcastle Writers Festival 'crazy' to invite author Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.summary: The festival's director said Dr Abdel-Fattah was invited in August last year and denied the state government pressured her to remove the writer.

items.title: Brodie Jake Dewar faces upgraded charge of manslaughter after Labor identity Tim Picton's death
items.summary: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

items.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell expected to form into category two system in WA
items.summary: The Bureau of Meteorology says Tropical Cyclone Mitchell has a high chance of forming into a category two system, bringing destructive winds and heavy rain to northern WA.

items.title: Australia's surging expectations at the Winter Olympics come thanks to Geoff Henke's strident advocacy
items.summary: Australia is hoping Milano Cortina 2026 will be its most successful Winter Olympics in history. The reason for Australia's winter sports surge has its roots in a 70-year-old snubbing.

items.title: NSW Liberal leader Kellie Sloane talks Chris Minns, polls, slogan bans and Bondi
items.summary: The leader of the NSW opposition says the trait behind Premier Chris Minns's popularity is also his greatest weakness, declaring the Coalition is "absolutely in the game" to win next year's state election.

items.title: Plenty of barramundi expected to be caught this year after Queensland's wild weather
items.summary: Commercial fishers are hopeful for an abundance of barramundi after heavy rainfall from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji on the east coast and ongoing flooding in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

items.title: Grandmother removed from Toowoomba birth suite by security
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Beyond the Songs Inside: After the applause
items.summary: Creative prison programs are celebrated for their ability to heal and transform incarcerated people. But are they enough to break the cycle?

items.title: Queensland Jewish leader wants stronger crackdown on symbols, flags, and slogans in wake of Bondi attack
items.summary: Queensland Jewish Board of Deputies president Jason Steinberg has called on the state government to ramp up anti-hate laws in the wake of last year's Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Demersal fishing reforms drive fish and chip price rise on WA's south coast
items.summary: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

items.title: Magnetic fields, psychedelics and ketamine helping to treat the brain
items.summary: A Queensland not-for-profit mental health clinic that delivers novel therapies such as ketamine and psilocybin is expanding its services.

items.title: WA Premier Roger Cook writes letter to 13yo hero swimmer Austin Appelbee
items.summary: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

items.title: Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis defends controversial Perth and WA demersal fishing ban
items.summary: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

items.title: Voters in David Littleproud's seat of Maranoa weigh in amid Coalition split, One Nation surge
items.summary: As One Nation announces its plan to open an office in Longreach, the ABC speaks to voters in David Littleproud's electorate to get their thoughts on the Nationals leader.

items.title: NFL confirms Los Angeles Rams vs San Francisco 49ers in Australia at the MCG
items.summary: The first regular-season NFL match played on Australian shores has been confirmed as a clash between division rivals.

items.title: Late NSW tradie Brett Mckay connected with thousands by sharing cancer battle online
items.summary: When NSW tradie Brett Mckay started sharing videos of his cancer journey with his mates on social media, he did not expect thousands of strangers to come along for the ride.

items.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
items.summary: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

items.title: State coroner recommends NSW government adopt Escape. Hide. Tell awareness campaign

items.title: World Anti-Doping Agency bosses 'will look at' claims of penis enlargement in ski jumping
items.summary: The World Anti-Doping Agency will investigate bizarre claims in German newspaper Bild that ski jumpers are injecting substances into their penises to aid aerodynamics — and other stories from the Winter Olympics a day out from the opening ceremony.

items.title: An ex-jihadi and terror experts agree on one thing about extremism
items.summary: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil in December, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

items.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up

items.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
items.summary: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

items.title: Alleged attempted murder victim gives evidence in Shaun Michael Dunk trial
items.summary: A woman who was stabbed multiple times in an alleged attack which killed her colleague at an Adelaide real estate office tells a court of her “fight for life”. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

items.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
items.summary: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

items.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters

items.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
items.summary: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

items.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
items.summary: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

items.title: More than 200 Daly River residents evacuated amid flood threat, with most staying at Darwin's Foskey Pavilion
items.summary: Hundreds of Daly River residents have been evacuated to Darwin ahead of expected major flooding, with Foskey Pavilion set up to accommodate most of the evacuees.

items.title: Old Spirit ferries up sale with new berth 'on track' for October launch, TT-Line says
items.summary: Ferry operator TT-Line is confident its two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels will begin operating by October — but it says there is a "risk" its existing ships might not be sold by then.

items.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
items.summary: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

items.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo

items.title: How Super Bowl-bound Aussie Michael Dickson became NFL's best punter
items.summary: Michael Dickson has become one of the finest punters in the NFL, and could become just the second Australian to play in a victorious Super Bowl team.

items.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
items.summary: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

items.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases
items.summary: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

items.summary: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

items.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts

items.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
items.summary: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

items.summary: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

items.title: Australia announces Jakara Anthony, Matt Graham as 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics flag bearers
items.summary: Jakara Anthony and Matt Graham have been named as flag bearers for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games in Milano Cortina.

items.title: Ex-prince Andrew leaves Windsor home as British police investigate latest Epstein revelations
items.summary: British police are investigating Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor after new files suggest Jeffrey Epstein arranged for a woman to have sex with the former prince at his home at the Royal Lodge in 2010.

items.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
items.summary: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

items.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
items.summary: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

items.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
items.summary: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

items.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
items.summary: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

items.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
items.summary: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

items.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
items.summary: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

items.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
items.summary: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

items.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
items.summary: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

items.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
items.summary: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

items.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
items.summary: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

items.summary: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

items.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
items.summary: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

items.title: Drought-affected SA farmers able to access low-interest loans of up to $250,000
items.summary: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

items.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
items.summary: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.

items.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah to appear at one-off Adelaide literary festival Constellations
items.summary: Palestinian Australian author, lawyer and activist Randa Abdel-Fattah will be appearing at the one-off literary event created to fill the void left by the cancellation of this year's Adelaide Writers' Week, organisers have announced.

items.summary: From shaping to tuning — how much do you know about how an acoustic guitar is made?

items.title: Extreme heat will make Northern Territory unlivable within 40 years, activists warn
items.summary: The Climate Justice Alliance says rising temperatures and increasingly severe heatwaves present a direct and immediate threat to people across the Territory, particularly in the Top End.

items.title: Sarah Ferguson offered Jeffrey Epstein woman with 'great body' after his release from prison
items.summary: Emails contained in the Epstein files show former British royal Sarah Ferguson told the convicted child sex offender she knew a "single" woman with a "great body" he should meet, weeks after his 2009 release from prison.

items.title: What the Epstein files tell us about Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 'car crash' 2019 interview
items.summary: Documents released last week have shed more light on what the former prince might have been lying about in that fateful sit-down with the BBC's flagship current affairs program, Newsnight.
